page.title: 12SEVEN SISTERS COUNTRY PARK
page.content: A{COUNTRY PARK}IS A PLACE PROVIDING OPP0RTUNITIES FOR ALL TO ENJOY THE COUNTRYSIDE. IN MARCH 1971 THE EAST SUSSEX COUNTY COUNCIL ACQUIRED PART OF {THE CUCKMERE VALLEY AND SEVEN SISTERS {PARK}WITH ADJOINING DOWN LAND TO BE USED AS A COUNTRY PARK. { THE PARK CENTRE}PROVIDES INFORMATION AND FACILITIES FOR VISITORS. RANGERS MANAGE THE PARK. EXTENSIVE AREAS ARE AVAILIBLE FOR{LEISURE ACTIVITIES}SUCH AS WALKING AND CANOEING AND FOR STUDYING BIRDS, ANIMALS AND PLANTS. THE PARK IS FAMOUS FOR IT'S OUTSTANDING{SCENIC BEAUTY.}THERE IS EVIDENCE OF SETTLEMENT THERE SINCE NEOLITHIC TIMES. THE{MEANDERS, ESTUARY AND{HEADLANDS}ARE STUDIED BY NATURALISTS, GEOGRAPHERS AND ANTHROPOLOGISTS FROM FAR AND WIDE. IN{THE LIVING WORLD MUSEUM}NEXT TO THE PARK CENTRE, INSECTS ARE ON VIEW.
